meanings.definition: An ion that is attracted to an oppositely charged ion in a solution.
meanings.sent1: The counterions moved towards the positively charged ion in the solution.
meanings.sent2: In the experiment, the counterions neutralized the charge of the other ion.
meanings.sent3: The counterions in the solution were like friendly magnets, always sticking close to their oppositely charged partners.
meanings.sent4: As the dance of ions unfolded in the solution, the counterions played the role of harmonizers, bringing balance to the mix.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the counterions as tiny puzzle pieces fitting perfectly with their oppositely charged counterparts.

meanings.definition: Ions that balance the charge of another ion in a solution.
meanings.sent1: Adding more counterions helped stabilize the overall charge of the solution.
meanings.sent2: The counterions worked together to maintain the electrical equilibrium in the solution.
meanings.sent3: The counterions were like the loyal sidekicks of the main ion, always ready to lend a helping charge.
meanings.sent4: In the world of ions, the counterions were the unsung heroes, silently ensuring everything stayed in perfect balance.
meanings.sent5: The counterions acted as the silent guardians of charge, ensuring no ion went astray in the solution.
